sheep.game
Class State

java.lang.Object
  sheep.game.State
All Implemented Interfaces:
KeyboardListener, TouchListener
public class State
extends java.lang.Object
implements KeyboardListener, TouchListener

You should inherit from this class to create the various states for your game. Each subclass should override the update and draw method to implement the game logic and rendering logic, respectively. At any time, the top State on the state stack receives events from the keyboard ad touch screen, and objects may listen to these events by subscribing to its parent state.

          Creates a new State.

removeKeyboardListener

public void removeKeyboardListener(KeyboardListener listener)
Removes a KeyboardListener to this State. If not present, nothing happens.

Parameters:
listener - The KeyboardListener to remove.

removeTouchListener

public void removeTouchListener(TouchListener listener)
Removes a TouchListener to this State. If not present, nothing happens.

Parameters:

update

public void update(float dt)
This function is called when the game state should be updated.

Parameters:
dt - The time since last frame.

draw

This function is called when the game state should be drawn on screen.
